image.description:
image
Define the png image to read in this noise map

Iris Image
* Default Value is 
Must be a valid images (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)
image.x-intellij-html-description:
image
Define the png image to read in this noise map

Iris Image
* Default Value is
Must be a valid images (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

coordinateScale.description:
coordinateScale
The amount of distance a single pixel is when reading this map, reading x=13, would still read pixel 0 if the scale is 32. You can zoom this externally through noise styles for zooming out.

Number
* Default Value is 32.0
* Minimum allowed is 1.0
coordinateScale.x-intellij-html-description:
coordinateScale
The amount of distance a single pixel is when reading this map, reading x=13, would still read pixel 0 if the scale is 32. You can zoom this externally through noise styles for zooming out.

Number
* Default Value is 32.0
* Minimum allowed is 1.0

interpolationMethod.description:
interpolationMethod
The interpolation method if the coordinateScale is greater than 1. This blends the image into noise. For nearest neighbor, use NONE.

InterpolationMethod
An interpolation method (or function) is simply a method of smoothing a position based on surrounding points on a grid. Bicubic for example is smoother, but has 4 times the checks than Bilinear for example. Try using BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 for beautiful results.
    
* Default Value is BILINEAR_STARCAST_6
Must be a valid InterpolationMethod (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)
interpolationMethod.x-intellij-html-description:
interpolationMethod
The interpolation method if the coordinateScale is greater than 1. This blends the image into noise. For nearest neighbor, use NONE.

InterpolationMethod
An interpolation method (or function) is simply a method of smoothing a position based on surrounding points on a grid. Bicubic for example is smoother, but has 4 times the checks than Bilinear for example. Try using BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 for beautiful results.

* Default Value is BILINEAR_STARCAST_6
Must be a valid InterpolationMethod (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

channel.description:
channel
The channel of the image to read from. This basically converts image data into a number betwen 0 to 1 per pixel using a certain 'channel/filter'

ImageChannel
Determines a derived channel of an image to read
    
* Default Value is COMPOSITE_ADD_HSB
Must be a valid ImageChannel (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)
channel.x-intellij-html-description:
channel
The channel of the image to read from. This basically converts image data into a number betwen 0 to 1 per pixel using a certain 'channel/filter'

ImageChannel
Determines a derived channel of an image to read

* Default Value is COMPOSITE_ADD_HSB
Must be a valid ImageChannel (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

inverted.description:
inverted
Invert the channel input

Boolean
* Default Value is false
inverted.x-intellij-html-description:
inverted
Invert the channel input

Boolean
* Default Value is false

tiled.description:
tiled
Tile the image coordinates

Boolean
* Default Value is false
tiled.x-intellij-html-description:
tiled
Tile the image coordinates

Boolean
* Default Value is false

centered.description:
centered
Center 0,0 to the center of the image instead of the top left.

Boolean
* Default Value is true
centered.x-intellij-html-description:
centered
Center 0,0 to the center of the image instead of the top left.

Boolean
* Default Value is true

oneOf.description: No interpolation. Nearest Neighbor (bad for terrain, great for performance).
oneOf.x-intellij-html-description: No interpolation. Nearest Neighbor (bad for terrain, great for performance).

oneOf.description: Uses 4 nearby points in a square to calculate a 2d slope. Very fast but creates square artifacts. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bilinear_interpolation
oneOf.x-intellij-html-description: Uses 4 nearby points in a square to calculate a 2d slope. Very fast but creates square artifacts. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bilinear_interpolation

oneOf.description: Starcast is Iris's own creation. It uses raytrace checks to find a horizontal boundary nearby. 3 Checks in a circle. Typically starcast is used with another interpolation method. See BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 For example. Starcast is meant to 'break up' large, abrupt cliffs to make cheap interpolation smoother.
oneOf.x-intellij-html-description: Starcast is Iris's own creation. It uses raytrace checks to find a horizontal boundary nearby. 3 Checks in a circle. Typically starcast is used with another interpolation method. See BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 For example. Starcast is meant to 'break up' large, abrupt cliffs to make cheap interpolation smoother.

oneOf.description: Starcast is Iris's own creation. It uses raytrace checks to find a horizontal boundary nearby. 6 Checks in a circle. Typically starcast is used with another interpolation method. See BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 For example. Starcast is meant to 'break up' large, abrupt cliffs to make cheap interpolation smoother.

oneOf.description: Bicubic noise creates 4, 4-point splines for a total of 16 checks. Bcubic can go higher than expected and lower than expected right before a large change in slope.
